intro: Lycianthes arrazolensis var. patentipila, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, berry-like, and often contain several seeds. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
